alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Haskell; Latimer; Le Flore; Pittsburg; Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 28 at 9:13PM CDT until October 29 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Choctaw, Haskell, Latimer, Le Flore, Pittsburg and Pushmataha. * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Recent heavy rainfall over parts of southeast Oklahoma has left soils saturated. Showers and a few thunderstorms are expected to develop today across the area, with high rainfall rates potentially leading to localized excessive runoff. The chance of rain will persist through Sunday night with potential for periods of additional heavy rainfall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Choctaw; Haskell; Latimer; Le Flore; Pittsburg; Pushmataha
